official-title.#text: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire approximately 44 acres of land in Martinez, California, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed

action-desc.#text: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: John Muir National Historic Site land acquisition

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may acquire by donation the approximately 44 acres of land, and interests in such land, that are identified on the map entitled

quote.#text: John Muir National Historic Site Proposed Boundary Expansion

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall adjust the boundaries of the John Muir Historic Site in Martinez, California, to include the land identified on the map referred to in subsection (a).

text.#text: Upon the acquisition of the land authorized by subsection (a), the
The land and interests in land acquired under subsection (a) shall be administered as part of the John Muir National Historic Site established by the Act of August 31, 1964

quote.#tail: are held in title by the Muir Heritage Land Trust by May 31, 2015.
quote.#text: John Muir National Historic Site Proposed Boundary Expansion

text.#text: The authority provided in subsections (a), (b), and (c) shall apply only if the lands identified on the map entitled
